arts.ttl: Lennon Miller 'lucky' to avoid Rangers red card as ex ref tells Motherwell star exactly what VAR should have done
arts.sum: The midfielder escaped with just a booking from referee Kevin Clancy

arts.sum: It could be a busy January at Ibrox as the squad turnover continues
Highlights of the Scottish Premiership game between Motherwell and Rangers.

arts.ttl: Philippe Clement under pressure as Rangers fall 14 points behind leaders Celtic
arts.sum: Rangers fell further behind Premiership leaders Celtic ahead of their meeting at Ibrox

arts.ttl: Robin Propper accused of unseen Rangers sin after Motherwell 'handball' as VAR lands two pronged defence
arts.sum: It was another tough afternoon for the Dutchman at the heart of the Light Blues defence

arts.ttl: Raging Stuart Kettlewell slams Rangers goal chalk off as 'flabbergasted' Motherwell boss lets rip
arts.sum: The fuming boss didn't hold back after his side were denied at a crucial moment

arts.ttl: Philippe Clement insists he doesn't fear Rangers sack as under fire boss points to 'clear statement' from board
arts.sum: The Belgian boss watched his side fall 14 points behind Celtic after a draw with Motherwell

arts.ttl: Jack Butland escapes Rangers 'mess' with Motherwell no goal as Tony Watt 'lean' sparks VAR defence
arts.sum: The goalkeeper appeared to hand the Steelmen a goal in their draw at Fir Park

arts.ttl: Raging Rangers fans want Clement the dumpling out – Hotline demands he's binned BEFORE Celtic
arts.athr: reporters@dailyrecord.co.uk (Sports Hotline, Graeme Young, Robbie Copeland)
arts.sum: Graeme Young and Robbie Copeland take your calls as Celtic take a big step towards the title

arts.ttl: Scottish Premiership roundup: Rangers’ latest slip gifts Celtic 14-point lead at top
arts.sum: Motherwell pegged back for 2-2 draw after eventful game Bhoys beat St Johnstone 4-0; Ross County deny Hearts A second-half double from substitute Hamza Igamane rescued a 2-2 draw for Rangers at Motherwell but the disjointed visitors fell further behind Premiership leaders Celtic. Philippe Clement came under fresh fire following the 2-1 Boxing Day defeat at St Mirren and there was uproar among the travelling supporters as Apostolos Stamatelopoulos put the hosts ahead in the 16th minute before Tawanda Maswanhise added a second in the 35th minute. Half-time replacement Igamane reduced the deficit in the 50th minute before Well boss Stuart Kettlewell was shown a red card by referee Kevin Clancy, possibly for dissent. Continue reading...
